titles.title: Foreign Influence Reporting in Elections Act
Foreign Influence Reporting in Elections Act

A bill to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to clarify the obligation to report acts of foreign election influence and require implementation of compliance and reporting systems by Federal campaigns to detect and report such acts.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.

term.name: Government ethics and transparency, public corruption

bill.summary:
Foreign Influence Reporting in Elections Act
This bill requires all campaign officials to report any contacts (i.e., offers of contributions or services) by foreign nationals.
